meanings.definition: To make modern in appearance or style.
meanings.sent1: She modernised her wardrobe by adding trendy pieces.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer modernised the living room with sleek furniture.
meanings.sent3: The old castle was modernised with neon lights, creating a unique look.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas modernised the company's approach, breathing new life into the business.
meanings.sent5: The artist modernised the traditional painting style, attracting a younger audience.

meanings.definition: To bring up to date in technology or methods.
meanings.sent1: He modernised the factory by installing new machinery.
meanings.sent2: The school modernised its curriculum to include online learning tools.
meanings.sent3: The chef modernised the recipe by using a microwave, much to the surprise of the guests.
meanings.sent4: The software update modernised the user interface, making it more user-friendly.
meanings.sent5: The scientist modernised the research process, streamlining data collection.
